content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

entries.title: Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
entries.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

entries.title: Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: Save $300 on AI caption and transcription platform Joyspace, now $79.99
entries.snippet:
The article promotes a significant discount on a lifetime subscription to Joyspace, an AI-powered captioning and transcription platform, now available for $79.99 (originally $379). Joyspace allows users to automatically generate captions for videos and transcribe recordings or podcasts using AI. With the Essential Plan, subscribers receive 80 minutes of transcription and 160 credits per month, as well as a 45-minute video export limit.

The plan also includes features such as watermark-free video, downloadable transcripts, instant captions, unlimited downloads and templates, and access to B-roll media like images and GIFs. Supporting 35 languages, Joyspace makes it easy to work with multi-lingual content without needing bilingual services. The platform allows customization of captions to match brand aesthetics and offers tools like animated emojis and timing adjustments for readability.

Beyond accessibility for the hearing-impaired, captions support silent viewing and content virality. Joyspace aims to streamline content creation for webinars, podcasts, and videos, helping creators maximize reach and user engagement.

entries.title: SPGISpeech 2.0: Transcribed multi-speaker financial audio for speaker-tagged transcription
Plaud Desktop brings its powerful AI transcription tool to your PC or Mac - and it's free
entries.snippet:
Plaud has released Plaud Desktop, a free AI transcription app for existing Plaud members, designed for PC and Mac users. It allows users to record, transcribe, and summarize meetings automatically across major video conferencing platforms like Zoom, Teams, Google Meet, and Slack. A key feature is its bot-free system that detects meeting start times and supports interactive search in over 112 languages. Transcripts, audio recordings, and summaries are stored in the user‚Äôs Plaud account with enhanced functionality, such as manual note adding, audio highlighting, and screenshot capture. This integration brings Plaud‚Äôs powerful AI from mobile devices to the desktop environment.

Alongside this, Plaud also launched the NotePin S, an upgraded wearable recording device. It offers increased battery life (up to 20 hours of recording and 40 days standby), improved audio quality with dual microphones, and 64GB storage. It‚Äôs lightweight, comes in three colors, supports multiple attachments, and is compatible with Apple Find My. The recordings sync securely via Bluetooth or WiFi and remain encrypted. The NotePin S retails for $179 (¬£133) and is available now.

v.title: HarperValleyBank: A Domain-Specific Spoken Dialog Corpus
4 Visual Voicemail Apps to Try in 2026
v.snippet:
The article ‚Äú4 Visual Voicemail Apps to Try in 2026‚Äù highlights top visual voicemail apps for iPhone and Android that help users manage and read voicemail messages via transcriptions. These apps convert voice messages to text, making it faster to review and prioritize calls.

1. **Google Voice** is the best free visual voicemail option, offering easy setup and support for Spanish transcription. It provides a free, dedicated number and sends transcripts via email or SMS. Downsides include the default new number setup and potential fees for number changes.

2. **HulloMail** is ideal for frequent voicemail users. It enables transcript searches, custom greetings, and call blocking. It has no free version and requires a subscription after the trial.

3. **YouMail** offers broad accessibility across devices and includes added features like robocall blocking and personalized greetings. The free plan includes ads and limits transcriptions to the first 30 seconds.

4. **InstaVoice** supports visual voicemail for up to ten numbers and offers a chat-like interface to manage messages efficiently. While its feature set is more limited than competitors, it‚Äôs strong on usability and multi-number support.

The article suggests checking with carriers first as many provide built-in visual voicemail solutions.

entries.title: Best speech-to-text app of 2025
entries.snippet:
This comprehensive 2025 TechRadar guide ranks the top speech-to-text apps and services designed to simplify converting spoken language into written text across mobile, desktop, and cloud platforms. Speech-to-text tools have moved from niche uses to broader applications in business, education, and everyday productivity. As voice recognition accuracy has greatly improved, many platforms now boast around 99% transcription accuracy.

Key offerings include:

- **Speechmatics**, praised for its multilingual, accent-flexible AI-driven transcription tools.
- **Dragon Professional**, ideal for business use with high accuracy and productivity tools.
- **Otter**, optimized for mobile and collaborative note-taking during meetings.
- **Verbit**, tailored for enterprise and education with hybrid AI and human transcription.
- **Braina Pro**, a PC-based voice assistant offering versatile command and dictation support.
- **Microsoft Azure Speech to Text** and **IBM Watson**, both cloud-native enterprise solutions offering real-time and batch transcription with customizable language models.
- **Dragon Anywhere**, a mobile app delivering professional-grade dictation in the cloud.
- **Amazon Transcribe**, optimized for business use with live and batch processing.

Top free options include Google Gboard, Just Press Record, Speechnotes, and built-in features like Windows Speech Recognition. Additional apps like iTranslate, Voice Notes, and SpeechTexter highlight specialized capabilities for translation, note organization, and social media use. The guide concludes with advising selection based on user needs and testing methodology.
